intro: Zigara tenuis, commonly known as the slender zigara, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open grasslands and rocky areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its slender stems and small, daisy-like flowers make it a distinctive feature in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, Zigara tenuis is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
